intro: Seseli galioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
